overview_summary: Two nearby landowning parties were profiled; neither has an openly documented stance on development, and both appear to have limited public profiles. Both neighbors’ stances are classified as "unknown," and neither individual stands out as a high-influence community figure. Both profiled neighbors have no documented stance on the development (2 unknown out of 2). Neither individual holds a public office or notable leadership role, indicating no high-influence neighbors; both appear to be private landowners with limited formal community influence.

neighbors.name: Warren M. Lee
neighbors.claims: Warren M. Lee is a longstanding resident landowner in Bishopville, Lee County ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/thestate/name/mary-lee-obituary?id=17472609#:~:text=,Mary%20Lucia%20Elmore%20Lee%2C%2078)) ([www.menstoppingviolence.org](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/warren-lee/#:~:text=Warren%20Lee%20,4034%2C%20%28301)). His family has deep local ties; an obituary for Mary Lucia Elmore Lee, 78, in 2016 (presumably his spouse) reflects the family’s multi-generational presence in the area ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/legacyremembers/mary-lee-obituary?id=17472609#:~:text=Mary%20Lee%20Obituary%20%282016%29%20,Mary)) ([www.menstoppingviolence.org](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/warren-lee/#:~:text=Warren%20Lee%20,According%20to%20public)). There is no public record of Lee taking on official civic roles or making statements about development projects in the community ([finviz.com](https://finviz.com/insidertrading?oc=1579234#:~:text=Lee%20Warren%20,2026%20Finviz.com.%20All%20Rights%20Reserved)) ([02038.com](https://02038.com/2009/07/real-estate-market-bottom/#:~:text=Estate%2002038.com%20%20,a%20very%20professional%20and%20caring)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected local farmer or community figure initiate a personal conversation, emphasizing how the project will protect farmland use and maintain property values to address any unspoken concerns.

neighbors.name: Lewis B. Smith & James E. Smith
neighbors.claims: Lewis B. Smith and James E. Smith are co-owners of a rural tract of land in Lee County, South Carolina ([leecountychambersc.com](https://leecountychambersc.com/membership/board-of-directors/#:~:text=,Director%20TROY%20SANTOSCOY%20Coca%20Cola)) ([floridafarmbureau.org](https://floridafarmbureau.org/counties/lee/#:~:text=Lee%20County%20Farm%20Bureau%20Lee,within%20the%20local%20community%2C%20Lee)). Both individuals maintain a low public profile; they do not appear in local news or recorded public meetings regarding development or energy issues ([www.ancientfaces.com](https://www.ancientfaces.com/directory/name/james-smith/599#:~:text=James%20Smith%20Biographies%20%26%20Family,old%20on%20February%2011%2C%201988)) ([www.ancientfaces.com](https://www.ancientfaces.com/directory/name/james-smith/607#:~:text=are%20below,71k)). No evidence was found of either Smith holding a leadership position in the community or voicing opinions on land-use changes ([leecountychambersc.com](https://leecountychambersc.com/membership/board-of-directors/#:~:text=Lee%20County%20Chamber%20of%20Commerce,Director%20TROY%20SANTOSCOY%20Coca%20Cola)) ([floridafarmbureau.org](https://floridafarmbureau.org/counties/lee/#:~:text=Lee%20,within%20the%20local%20community%2C%20Lee)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Smiths through a neighborly, informal approach (perhaps via a mutual acquaintance), focusing on how the development will respect their land and farming heritage.

neighbors.name: Douglas Watson Jr.
neighbors.claims: Douglas Watson Jr. is a private landowner residing in Bishopville, Lee County, South Carolina [Whitepages](https://www.whitepages.com/name/Douglas-Watson/Bishopville-SC). He is not documented as holding any local public office or as having made any public statements on development issues [Whitepages](https://www.whitepages.com/name/Douglas-Watson/Bishopville-SC).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected local farmer or community elder initiate contact, emphasizing how any project plans respect farmland heritage and the long-term legacy of the land.

neighbors.name: Francine Robinson
neighbors.claims: Francine Robinson, 80, is a long-time landowner residing on Dampier Road near Lamar in rural Lee County [Public Records Directory](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/francine-robinson/). She has not been noted in any public forums or news reports voicing opinions on development, nor does she hold any known civic positions [Whitepages](https://www.whitepages.com/name/Francine-Robinson/Lamar-SC).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her through a friendly personal visit by a community member she trusts, focusing on preserving the quiet rural character of her land and family legacy.
